title: Resistance - I-V curve for a nonohmic device

content.question: The graph shows the current <math alttext="I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> in a circuit element as a function of the potential difference <math alttext="delta V " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> across the element. Which of the following pairs of claims about the circuit element is correct?

choices.label: The ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V over I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math> increases as <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> increases, and the element is ohmic.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V over I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math> increases as <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>V</mi></math> increases, and the element is NOT ohmic.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V over I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math> decreases as <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> increases, and the element is ohmic.

The ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V over I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math> decreases as <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> increases, and the element is NOT ohmic.

content.answer: The ratio <math alttext="the fraction delta V over I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>I</mi></mfrac></math> decreases as <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> increases, and the element is NOT ohmic.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
